messages.content:
You are a debugging assistant. You will be presented with a failing test, and tools (functions) to access the source code of the system under test (SUT). Your task is to provide a step-by-step explanation of how the bug occurred, based on the failing test and the information you retrieved using tests about the SUT. You will be given 9 chances to interact with functions to gather relevant information. An example answer would look like follows.

Title: Diagnosis of test `testGenerateURLFragment`
Details: The test `testGenerateURLFragment` checks whether HTML entities such as `"` are correctly escaped to their corresponding character by the `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` method. However, the test failure indicates that this is not the case. Following the execution path, we find that `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` is not escaping any HTML code; instead, it is using its input `toolTipText` as is. Consequently, un-escaped strings are being returned, which leads to the error demonstrated by the test.

After providing this diagnosis, you will be prompted to suggest which methods would be the best locations to be fixed. The answers should be in the form of `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` without commentary (one per line), as your answer will be automatically processed before finally being presented to the user.

The test `['org.apache.commons.lang.StringEscapeUtilsTest.testEscapeHtmlHighUnicode()']` failed.
The test looks like:

```java
420 :     public void testEscapeHtmlHighUnicode() throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException {
421 :         // this is the utf8 representation of the character:
422 :         // COUNTING ROD UNIT DIGIT THREE
423 :         // in unicode
424 :         // codepoint: U+1D362
425 :         byte[] data = new byte[] { (byte)0xF0, (byte)0x9D, (byte)0x8D, (byte)0xA2 };
426 : 
427 :         String escaped = StringEscapeUtils.escapeHtml( new String(data, "UTF8") );
428 :         String unescaped = StringEscapeUtils.unescapeHtml( escaped );
429 : 
430 :         assertEquals( "High unicode was not escaped correctly", "𝍢", escaped); // error occurred here
431 :     }
```

It failed with the following error message and call stack:

```
junit.framework.ComparisonFailure: High unicode was not escaped correctly expected:<&#[119650];> but was:<&#[55348;&#57186];>
	at org.apache.commons.lang.StringEscapeUtilsTest.testEscapeHtmlHighUnicode(StringEscapeUtilsTest.java:430)
escaped = ��
FOO = foo
unescaped = 𝍢
class$org$apache$commons$lang$StringEscapeUtilsTest = class org.apache.commons.lang.StringEscapeUtilsTest
htmlEscapes = [[Ljava.lang.String;@506e1b77
data = [B@4fca772d
class$org$apache$commons$lang$StringEscapeUtils = null
```

Start by calling the `get_failing_tests_covered_classes` function.

The failing test `org.apache.commons.lang.StringEscapeUtilsTest.testEscapeHtmlHighUnicode()` is covering the classes `Entities`, `IntHashMap`, and `StringEscapeUtils` in the `org.apache.commons.lang` package. 

Next, I will check the methods covered by the failing test in the `StringEscapeUtils` class. I will use the `get_failing_tests_covered_methods_for_class` function for this purpose.

The failing test `org.apache.commons.lang.StringEscapeUtilsTest.testEscapeHtmlHighUnicode()` covers the methods `escapeHtml(java.lang.String)` and `unescapeHtml(java.lang.String)` in the `StringEscapeUtils` class.

I will now retrieve the code snippets for these methods to investigate further.

messages.name: get_code_snippet
get_code_snippet

messages.content:
The `escapeHtml(String str)` and `unescapeHtml(String str)` methods in the `StringEscapeUtils` class both use a `StringWriter` internally to perform the HTML escaping and unescaping operations.

The failing test `testEscapeHtmlHighUnicode` in `StringEscapeUtilsTest` checks if high unicode characters are escaped and unescaped correctly. The error occurred on the assertion expecting `𝍢` but getting `��`.

Based on the code snippets, it seems like the methods in `StringEscapeUtils` are not handling the high unicode character properly during escape and unescape operations, which leads to the failure of the test.

Next, I will suggest the methods that need to be fixed in the `StringEscapeUtils` class to address this issue.
```
org.apache.commons.lang.StringEscapeUtils.escapeHtml(java.lang.String)
org.apache.commons.lang.StringEscapeUtils.unescapeHtml(java.lang.String)
```

Based on the available information, provide the signatures of the most likely culprit methods for the bug. Your answer will be processed automatically, so make sure to only answer with the accurate signatures of all likely culprits (in `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` format), without commentary (one per line).
